      • entityAdjustCoordinateState

        public void entityAdjustCoordinateState(long timeMillis,
                                        long timePassedMillis)
        Description copied from class: GameEntity
        Adjusts the entity coordinates according to the given time.

        The default implementation is as follows
        1. Calculate the current velocity with GameEntity.entityCalculateVelocity(long)
        2. Calculate the current coordinates with GameEntity.entityCalculateCoordinates(long, IPoint2f)
        3. Calculate the coordinates after collision with GameEntity.entityCalculateCollision(IPoint2f)
        4. Assign the resulting coordinates with GameEntity.entityMove(IPoint2f)
        Overrides:
        entityAdjustCoordinateState in class GameEntity

      • entityAdjustGraphicState

        public void entityAdjustGraphicState(long timeMillis,
                                     long timePassedMillis)
        Description copied from class: GameEntity
        Adjusts the entity graphics according to the given time.

        The default implementation works as follows
        1. If the image is enabled, it will be asked for a graphic (GameEntity.getGraphicsImage()).
        2. If the image is disabled or the returned graphic is null, graphic base will be used.
        3. If the graphic base is null as well, the graphic value will be null.

        Note: The graphic will only be set if it is different to the previous one.
        Overrides:
        entityAdjustGraphicState in class GameEntity
